Comment: They could. But there is a substantial difference between a shared body of water and a land controlled by a sovereign government. The Gulf does not have a name that is determined by a sovereign body, as there is none. The Gulf of Mexico name is used by various international bodies, but none of them has truly control on it, they just come to an agreement to a name to use to refer to it, usually the most commonly agreed by countries, especially the closest to the feature.   Renaming the USA as you suggest, on the other hand, is a clear act that is refusing to accept the naming that the body that governs that land as decided. I think most would agree that it much more offensive.
